meanings.definition: Relating to or affected by jaundice.
meanings.sent1: The doctor noticed the icteric skin color of the patient, indicating jaundice.
meanings.sent2: Her icteric complexion made it clear she was suffering from jaundice.
meanings.sent3: The icteric hue of the painting gave it a unique and unexpected charm.
meanings.sent4: The icteric glow of the streetlights in the fog created an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The icteric leaves on the tree stood out vividly against the green backdrop.

meanings.sent1: The icteric eyes of the patient revealed the presence of jaundice.
meanings.sent2: His icteric appearance was a clear sign of the jaundice affecting him.
meanings.sent3: The icteric tone of his voice added a touch of humor to the situation.
meanings.sent4: Her icteric mood cast a yellow shadow over the room, like a jaundiced sky.
meanings.sent5: The icteric glow of the streetlights in the fog created an eerie atmosphere.
